medical_history.chief_complaint: Incidental finding of asymptomatic hyperCKemia (26,372 IU/L)
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with high-performance sports engagement for 3 hours daily, with no myalgia, cramps, or pigmenturia during or after physical activity. HyperCKemia persisted above 20,000 IU/L despite cessation of sports. Six months after initial presentation, patient started to experience proximal muscle weakness of both lower limbs, worsening after a second monthly IVMP treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: No history of familial neuromuscular disorder, parental consanguinity, or exposure to myotoxic medications or substances.
medical_history.family_history: Mother was a carrier of the c.3851C > T mutation; father had the c.5979dup mutation.
